page.title: 04LICHFIELD EDUCATION
page.content: {St.Michael's Church of England primary school} is for children aged four and a half to eleven years old.The school has got two buildings.The new school is about 20 years old and the annexe is about 120 years old. In the whole school there are about 450 children split into 15 different classes.Children spend two years in the infants and four years in the juniors. Four years are spent at the new school and two at the annexe. At the new school there is a swimming pool which the infants and lower juniors use.The upper juniors go swimming at the Friary Grange Sports Centre. In games lessons,girls play netball and boys play football and in the summer rounders is played.
